statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ 4 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 0 \\ -6 \\ 3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 3 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -2 \\ -8 \\ 1 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 16 \\ 1 \\ 13 \\ -10 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ 4 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 0 \\ -6 \\ 3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 3 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -2 \\ -8 \\ 1 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 16 \\ 1 \\ 13 \\ -10 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
